title: 'Delete Central govt': Mamata sets condition to back SIR; attacks EC, BJP over survey
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressed affection for Bangladesh due to shared language and criticized the BJP-led central government and Election Commission over the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls. She warned against rushing the process before the 2026 polls and accused the EC of losing impartiality, calling it a 'BJP Commission'.

title: 'Secret deal': DKS refuses to speak on K'taka CM row; what Kharge said
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar described the CM change issue as a "secret deal" among a few party leaders, stating he wouldn't discuss it publicly to avoid embarrassing the organization. He emphasized the importance of party unity and conscience. Meanwhile, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge also stressed that leadership changes are not for public discussion.

title: 'Zubeen Garg murdered': Assam CM makes big claim; hints at shocking motive
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma declared singer Zubeen Garg's death in Singapore a "plain and simple murder" in the state Assembly. He stated one person was responsible, with others aiding them. The opposition's adjournment motion to discuss the circumstances was admitted, with a Special Investigation Team and a judicial commission probing the incident.

title: 'No good and bad Taliban': Pak refutes attacking Afghanistan; Kabul vows retaliation
content: Pakistan's military on Tuesday vehemently denied Afghan Taliban claims of conducting overnight airstrikes within Afghanistan, which reportedly killed ten people.  The Afghan government condemned the alleged "hostile actions" as a violation of sovereignty and vowed a response. Pakistan's army spokesperson dismissed the accusations as "baseless," highlighting a growing border dispute.

title: US recession fears: Nvidia CEO to employees at town hall; Says only thing standing between is ‘Us’
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated the company's performance is critical to the global economy, acting as a safeguard against recession. He highlighted the immense pressure Nvidia faces as the backbone of the AI boom, with its success viewed as crucial for both Silicon Valley and Wall Street.

title: 'China running racket': EU attacks Beijing; rare earth curbs cause rift
content: The EU has strongly criticized China's control over rare earth exports, with a top official labeling Beijing's restrictions a "racket" that jeopardizes Europe's strategic autonomy.  The bloc is urged to accelerate efforts to reduce its dependence on Chinese critical minerals by diversifying supply chains and strengthening domestic capacity.

title: South Africa eye clean sweep as India stare at a mountain they can not climb
content: India faces an uphill battle in the final Test, needing an improbable 522 runs after losing two early wickets. South Africa declared at 260/5, setting a daunting target. With a series sweep looming, the Proteas aim to take eight wickets on the final day, while India must survive an almost impossible chase.

title: 'Until Brahmin donates daughter': IAS officer's remark stirs row; issues clarification
content: A senior IAS officer in Madhya Pradesh faces backlash after a viral video showed him linking reservation continuation to inter-caste marriage. The All India Brahmin Society condemned the remarks as "indecent" and "casteist," demanding an FIR and disciplinary action. The officer later clarified his statement was taken out of context, expressing regret if sentiments were hurt.

title: Gemini 3.0 launch: Salesforce CEO says won't use ChatGPT again; praises Google’s AI model
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff declared he's switching from ChatGPT to Google's Gemini 3.0 after a two-hour trial, citing significant improvements in reasoning, speed, image, and video processing. This endorsement highlights the intense competition in the AI landscape, with even OpenAI's CEO acknowledging Google's advancements.

title: 3 night time drinks that can help reduce High Blood Pressure in the morning
content: The minerals, calcium, potassium and magnesium present in milk help blood vessels relax, while maintaining proper fluid equilibrium. The cardiovascular system experiences reduced pressure because of these effects, which also enhance artery flexibility

title: Madeline Mann spills the beans on mastering the interview question most candidates get wrong
content: Madeline Mann, founder of Self Made Millennial, explains why the seemingly simple “Tell me about yourself” question often determines the course of an interview. She breaks down a precise three-step method—aligning your background with the job, highlighting measurable achievements, and ending with a clear “why”—to help candidates deliver sharper, more purposeful introductions and avoid common pitfalls.

title: Bruins’ Charlie McAvoy hit by heartbreaking week as wife Kiley shares update
content: Boston Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy is going through a devastating week. As his wife Kiley McAvoy revealed an emotional family update on social media. With Charlie already recovering from recent jaw surgery. The couple is now facing additional personal challenges involving their young son.

title: Black Friday Sale 2025 goes live: Get iPhone 16 under Rs 40,000— how to grab the deal?
content: iPhone 16 is now available for under Rs 40,000. Black Friday sales on Amazon, Flipkart, and Croma offer significant discounts. Buyers can avail exchange bonuses and bank offers to lower the effective price. This makes the iPhone 16 an excellent option for those looking to upgrade or switch to Apple's ecosystem. The device features a refreshed design and enhanced capabilities.

title: Don’t look at top stocks to buy! Should you invest in stocks directly at all?
content: Direct stock investing demands significant time, temperament, and skill, often exceeding what most salaried individuals can commit. Full-time fund managers possess these advantages. For most, a diversified mutual fund portfolio offers a more realistic path to wealth creation, avoiding common investor pitfalls like panic selling and excessive trading. Direct stocks can be explored as a small, experimental allocation.

title: Wig, makeup & horror: Man impersonates dead mother for pension
content: A shocking case has emerged in Italy where a former nurse allegedly mummified his mother's body to impersonate her for three years, claiming her pension and controlling her properties. The elaborate fraud unraveled during a routine identity card renewal at the registry office, leading to the discovery of the mummified remains and serious charges against the man.

title: 'Misfit for Army': SC flays Christian soldier's indiscipline; refused command to enter temple
content: The Supreme Court has upheld the dismissal of a Christian Army soldier for refusing to enter a gurdwara during a regimental activity, deeming his actions "gross indiscipline." Justices labelled him an "absolute misfit," emphasizing the paramount importance of discipline in the Army. The soldier's appeal was rejected, confirming his termination for placing personal beliefs above lawful commands.

title: B'luru horror: Man injects wife with mercury; dowry angle being probed
content: A Karnataka homemaker has accused her husband of injecting her with mercury nine months prior to her death, leading to a slow decline in her health.  Before passing away, she provided a pre-death statement to police detailing the alleged assault and subsequent suffering. The case is now being investigated as a potential dowry-related death.

title: A guide for women to freeze eggs properly, risks, outcomes and expectations
content: Egg freezing offers women extended reproductive choice, but it's not a guarantee of future pregnancy. Success hinges on age and the number of mature eggs retrieved, with younger women and those aiming for around fifteen eggs seeing better outcomes. Understanding the process's limitations and costs is crucial for informed decision-making.

title: 'Shouldn't coach be sacked': Raina defends Gambhir, reveals Team India's 'problem'
content: Suresh Raina defended head coach Gautam Gambhir amidst India's Test struggles, emphasizing player accountability. He highlighted Gambhir's success in white-ball formats and stressed that coaches guide, while players must perform. Raina also advocated for domestic performance to influence selection, anticipating a stronger ODI squad with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's return for the South Africa series.

title: Wayne Gretzky faces backlash as ‘Trump’s Canadian mascot’ label spreads
content: Canada's hockey icon Wayne Gretzky faced boos at a recent event, sparking debate about his association with American politics.  Gretzky, asserting his Canadian identity, stated he's "Canadian for life."  His response highlights the complex relationship between national heroes, personal choices, and public expectations, revealing much about Canadian pride and how deeply they connect with their sports symbols.

title: ‘Buying veggies felt like a full academic module’: Indian student on life abroad
content: Neeharika's study abroad journey from Bengaluru to the UK reveals a profound personal transformation. She navigated initial quietude and daily challenges, learning independence through everyday tasks. University life demanded self-direction, while building a community provided crucial support. This experience underscores that growth abroad is subtle, unfolding through ordinary moments and quiet victories, ultimately proving immensely rewarding.

title: 'King in his kingdom': Kohli arrives in India ahead of ODI series against SA - Watch
content: Virat Kohli has arrived in India for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa. The series begins on November 30. KL Rahul will captain the team. Ravindra Jadeja returns to the squad. Axar Patel has been excluded. The matches will be held in Ranchi, Raipur, and Visakhapatnam. Kohli last played in the ODI series against Australia in October. ​​

title: Silent for 10,000 years… then a blast: Eyewitnesses recall Ethiopia volcano eruption — watch
content: A remote Ethiopian volcano, dormant for millennia, erupted violently, spewing ash 15km high and darkening skies.  Locals described the blast as a "bomb of smoke and ash." While no lives were lost, the eruption has severely impacted livestock-herding communities, with ash covering grazing lands and threatening livelihoods.  The event has caused widespread shock due to its unprecedented nature.

title: 'Centuries-old pain put to rest': PM Modi at 'Dhwaj Arohan' ceremony; key takeaways
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi ceremonially hoisted a saffron Dharma Dhwaj atop the Ram temple in Ayodhya, marking its formal construction completion. He stated that the 'pain of centuries finds rest today' and the resolve of centuries is attaining fulfillment. The flag symbolizes the renaissance of Indian civilisation and the ideals of Ram Rajya.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal jumps sharply; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold prices surged on Tuesday, driven by increasing expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut in December following dovish comments from officials. This optimism pushed bullion higher for the third consecutive session, with traders increasing bets on easier monetary policy. City-wise prices also saw an uptick across major Indian cities.

title: Kuwaiti authorities to revoke citizenship of prominent islamic Preacher
content: Kuwaiti authorities are set to revoke the citizenship of a prominent Islamic preacher, known for his media presence and cultural engagements, as part of efforts to safeguard the national identity system. The decision follows uniform legal standards applied to all similar cases. Formal procedures are underway, ensuring compliance with regulatory frameworks, while the preacher’s identity and family details remain undisclosed.

title: Megan Moroney addresses Nick Bosa dating rumors, says she’s focused on her career
content: Country star Megan Moroney is shutting down dating rumors, including those linking her to NFL player Nick Bosa, emphasizing her focus on a busy career. She clarifies past speculation about Morgan Wallen, stating they were never exclusively dating and remain friends. Moroney prioritizes authenticity and independence, building her success on honest songwriting and personal fulfillment, not romantic narratives.

title: 549-run target: Men in Blue hope for a miracle - what's highest total ever chased in India
content: South Africa declared their second innings at 260 for 5, setting India a daunting target of 549 runs. Tristan Stubbs' 94 and Tony de Zorzi's 49 anchored the innings after early wickets. This massive target represents the highest by a visiting team in India, posing a significant challenge for the hosts.

title: 'Will respond at right time': Taliban's warning after Pakistani air strikes kill 10
content: Overnight Pakistani air strikes in eastern Afghanistan killed 10 civilians, including nine children and one woman, prompting the Taliban to vow an "appropriate" response. The strikes in Khost, Kunar, and Paktika provinces injured four more civilians. This follows a deadly attack in Peshawar and previous cross-border clashes.

title: NEET PG counselling 2025 schedule revised: Registration for round 2 in Dec; check dates
content: The Medical Counselling Committee has released a revised schedule for NEET PG Round 2 counselling, commencing registration on December 5th. Key dates include choice filling until December 9th and results on December 12th.  Significant changes to the seat matrix involve adding 239 PG seats at deemed universities and removing 235 DNB seats. Reporting is scheduled from December 13th to 21st.

title: 'I don't need his money': Hema Malini on marrying Dharmendra
content: Dharmendra's personal life, particularly his marriage to Hema Malini while already married, is revisited. Malini recounts Dharmendra's initial charm and her eventual ultimatum, prioritizing his love over material possessions. She acknowledges their unconventional arrangement, living separately but emphasizing his consistent support for her and their daughters, stating she never wished to disrupt his existing family.

title: 'Continuous acts of abuse': Celina Jaitly files domestic violence case against husband
content: Former Miss India and Miss Universe runner-up Celina Jaitly Haag has initiated legal proceedings against her husband, Peter Haag, in a Mumbai court. The complaint details allegations of domestic violence, cruelty, and manipulation. The court has issued a notice to Haag, with the next hearing scheduled for December 12. Neither Jaitly nor Haag have publicly commented on the matter.

title: Making of Smaran R: How a coach transformed a hyper-active kid into run-scoring machine
content: Karnataka middle-order batter Smaran Ravichandran is going through a purple patch. After a steady 2024-25 Ranji Trophy season with 516 runs in seven matches, the southpaw has already amassed 595 runs in five matches in the 2025-26 season. In his brief 13-match career, the Bengaluru boy has already smashed three double centuries, was the hero of Karnataka’s Vijay Hazare title triumph, and is now knocking on the selectors’ door with his consistent performances across formats.

title: How the discovery of the ‘inner kernel’ may explain Neptune’s migration
content: Astronomers have discovered a new, previously unnoticed concentration of icy bodies in the Kuiper Belt, dubbed the 'inner kernel.' This finding, made possible by advanced clustering algorithms, suggests the cold classical belt is more layered than previously thought. It offers crucial new insights into Neptune's complex migration and the early evolution of our Solar System, challenging existing models.

title: Milap breaks down Sonam's ‘indecent proposal’ scene from Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat
content: Director Milap Zaveri defends the shocking interval twist in 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' where Sonam Bajwa's character offers a night with her to whoever kills Harshvardhan Rane's character. Zaveri explains it's a powerful, empowering move for the heroine, using her beauty and fame to fight an adversary, aligning with the idea that all is fair in love and war.

title: Trump’s H-1B visa & immigration crackdown: Indians look at EB-1A visa route - all you want to know
content: Indian professionals are shifting from H-1B visas to EB-1A, seeking exceptional ability green cards due to rising fees and stricter US immigration policies. This move offers greater stability and independence from employer sponsorship, especially amid tech layoffs.  The surge in EB-1A applications highlights a preference for predictable immigration pathways.

title: Watch: PM Modi hoists saffron Dharma Dhwaj atop Ayodhya's Ram Mandir
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat unfurled the saffron Dharma Dhwaj atop the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Temple's golden spire, marking the temple's completion. The historic flag-hoisting ceremony, held during the auspicious Abhijit Muhurat, was witnessed by thousands of devotees and dignitaries, symbolizing a new spiritual era for Ayodhya.

title: Stefon Diggs’ partner Cardi B makes gold pendant from baby’s umbilical cord
content: Cardi B commemorated her fourth child's birth by transforming her umbilical cord into a gold pendant and her placenta into vitamins. This unique practice, offered by Mommy Made Encapsulation, also includes creating a "Tree of Life" placenta print. The service aims to preserve the initial bond between parent and child, a trend embraced by other celebrities.

title: Ex-Hawks champ says Jay-Z could outscore Drake, Lil Wayne and Nicki in Verzuz
content: Former NBA star Jeff Teague ignited a hip-hop debate, boldly claiming Jay-Z could defeat Lil Wayne, Drake, and Nicki Minaj combined in a hypothetical Verzuz battle.  Teague argued Hov's extensive catalog and legacy are unparalleled, even dismissing a Roc-A-Fella vs. Young Money matchup as unfair. His strong stance reignited discussions on rap's hierarchy.

title: Former Lakers star Rick Fox calls his move into Bahamian politics “bigger” step
content: Former NBA star Rick Fox is entering Bahamian politics, seeking a seat in the House of Assembly. He aims to bring transparency, honesty, and excellence to governance, emphasizing his commitment to the nation's future.  Fox's move follows a distinguished career in basketball, acting, and esports, and his prior role as ambassador at large for sports.

title: 6 popular 'healthy' foods that are harmful for your heart
content: Commonly perceived healthy foods like bananas, spinach, grapefruit, soy sauce, liquorice, and alcohol can pose significant heart risks, especially for individuals with existing health conditions or on specific medications. Cardiologist Dmitry Yaranov highlights how these items can disrupt electrolyte balance, interfere with drug efficacy, and directly strain the cardiovascular system, urging caution and personalized dietary awareness.

title: 'I don’t care what Gautam Gambhir says': Ex-India captain explodes in fiery attack
content: Former captain Krishnamachari Srikkanth has launched a scathing attack on head coach Gautam Gambhir, criticizing India's selection policy after their struggles in the second Test against South Africa. Srikkanth questioned player omissions and the team's 'trial and error' approach, highlighting the contrast between India's batting collapse and South Africa's effective exploitation of the pitch.

title: Terror lens on UP maulana: Madrassa teacher on govt payroll, preacher in UK
content: A UP government teacher, Maulana Shamsul Huda Khan, drew a salary for ten years while living in the UK and acquiring British citizenship. Four minority welfare officials were suspended for complicity in facilitating his illegal salary, leave, and retirement benefits. The crackdown uncovers a decade-long conspiracy involving foreign-funded religious operations and radicalization attempts.

title: Jennings hits Moehrig after MNF over 'cheap shot'
content: 49ers wide receiver Jauan Jennings responded to a "cheap shot" from Tre'von Moehrig by throwing an open-handed right cross to the Panthers safety's face mask after the final whistle Monday night.

title: Sources: Bucs get good news on Mayfield's MRI
content: The MRI for Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield revealed a low-grade AC joint sprain in his left shoulder but showed no additional damage, sources told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler on Monday.

title: Pistons tie '90, '04 title teams, win 13th in row
content: Guard Cade Cunningham and the surging Detroit Pistons, who set an NBA record for consecutive losses in a single NBA season with 28 in 2023, tied a franchise record Monday night with their 13th straight victory, defeating the Indiana Pacers 122-117.

title: Attorneys: LSU saga hindering Kelly job candidacy
content: Attorneys for Brian Kelly have informed LSU in a letter that the school's claim that it had not "formally terminated" Kelly as its football coach has "made it nearly impossible" for Kelly to get another coaching job.

title: Herro keeps red-hot Heat rolling in season debut
content: Tyler Herro eventually got going in his return from ankle surgery in September and led Miami to a win over Dallas on Monday night.

title: Dodgers star Ohtani to play for Japan in WBC
content: Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani will play for Team Japan in the 2026 World Baseball Classic as the country looks to defend their 2023 title.

title: Chase sorry for spitting: 'What I did was wrong'
content: Bengals wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase apologized Monday for spitting on Steelers defensive back Jalen Ramsey.

title: Minority owners claim Ishbia mismanaging Suns
content: A pair of Phoenix Suns minority owners allege that Mat Ishbia is using the franchise as "his personal piggy bank" in a lawsuit claiming misconduct and mismanagement by the Suns' governor.

title: Bill Belichick's legacy takes a detour at North Carolina
content: A season in, the legendary NFL coach's head-scratching decision to helm a lowly ACC team continues to confound.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus Thanksgiving game memories
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 13. We also picked out Thanksgiving memories for 31 teams that have played on the holiday (sorry, Jaguars).

title: Jokic, SGA, Giannis and Luka are off to historic starts: Why this MVP race could be epic
content: Nikola Jokic, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Giannis Antetokounmpo and Luka Doncic are off to scorching starts. What does it mean for the MVP race?

title: Why LeBron James' most remarkable NBA streak is now at risk
content: James' double-digit scoring streak is intact, but his other streak is even more remarkable -- and now in danger.

title: Lane Kiffin has a near $100 million decision coming Saturday. He better win Friday
content: As drama at Ole Miss drags on, there's a game to play Friday. The pressure on Kiffin to win will be overwhelming.

title: Inside Lions DE Aidan Hutchinson's contract extension, and Micah Parsons' role
content: The Lions wanted to sign Hutchinson to a long-term contract, but deals for other pass rushers, especially Micah Parsons, kept moving the target.

title: Solak spins Week 12 forward: Should the Browns stick with Sanders? Could the Colts lose the AFC South?
content: Ben Solak sizes up Shedeur Sanders' first start, the sudden three-team race in the AFC South, George Pickens' next contract and Week 12 trends to watch.

title: They hired who?! Making sense of MLB's newest class of managers
content: A 33-year-old, a college coach, a recently retired reliever ... it's been quite an offseason for unconventional skippers. What does it mean?

title: How good are this year's top Japanese free agents -- and who could sign them?
content: We break down what to expect from Tatsuya Imai, Munetaka Murakami and Kazuma Okamoto in 2026 and where they might land.

title: Can the Predators turn their season around?
content: Nashville is the NHL's worst team in the standings. Is there any hope of contention -- or is it time to make trades?

title: Man United have improved under Amorim, but closer look at metrics paints harsh picture
content: It has been one year since Ruben Amorim's first game in charge of Man United. There has been some improvement, but the core metrics of Amorim's influence tell a different story.

title: Why Bayern boss Kompany is well placed to succeed Guardiola at Man City
content: If Bayern's clash with Arsenal is an audition to replace Pep Guardiola, ex-City defender and ESPN FC analyst Nedum Onuoha thinks Kompany fits the bill.

title: What to know about Damon Jones, the man at the center of two NBA scandals
content: After making more than $21 million across 11 seasons in the NBA, the NBA journeyman fell hard -- and, prosecutors allege, into a life of crime.

title: 30 best pro wrestlers under 30: Did 'Dirty Dom' repeat in 2025?
content: Who are the best young stars across professional wrestling? We rank the top 30 wrestlers under age 30.

title: WNBA mock draft: UConn's Fudd is new No. 1 as Wings win lottery
content: Azzi Fudd is the new projected No. 1 pick after Dallas won the draft lottery for the second consecutive year.

title: Predicting the USMNT's starting lineup at the World Cup: What previous tournaments tell us
content: When the USMNT plays in a World Cup, there are always some locks, and always some players who come out of nowhere to start games.

title: Ranking Ronaldo's overhead kick goals for Real Madrid, Portugal, Al Nassr
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's 954th career goal was one of his best, adding to his collection of stunning acrobatic strikes. Here they all are -- ranked!

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea, Man United eye new Germany star Ouédraogo
content: RB Leipzig midfielder Assan Ouédraogo is a target for Chelsea and Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Heisman Trophy race: Will Jeremiyah Love run past Fernando Mendoza, Julian Sayin?
content: The top candidates have emerged in the Heisman race, but what will it take for Jeremiyah Love to vault past Fernando Mendoza and Julian Sayin?

title: Pickups: Time to add Collin Gillespie, Derik Queen, Jusuf Nurkic
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: December schedule hacks: Stack your fantasy hockey lineups with Devils, Mammoth players
content: Your essential guide to lineup strategy for December, including how to use the NHL schedule to your advantage.

title: Weekly waiver pickups: Add these defensemen for assists, power-play points
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: Pakistani Couple Elopes, Crosses Into Kutch On Foot To Be Together
content: A Pakistani man and his girlfriend eloped from their homes and made an arduous journey on foot to the India-Pakistan border in Gujarat's Kutch district, only to be detained by the security forces.

title: Kash Patel's 3D-Printed Guns To New Zealand Officials Were Toy-Pistol Based
content: Inoperable pistols gifted by Kash Patel to senior New Zealand security officials, who had to relinquish them for destruction because they were illegal to possess, were revolvers inspired by toy Nerf guns and popular among 3D-printed weapon hobbyists.

title: 3 Arrested In Delhi For Rs 88 Lakh Digital Arrest Scam
content: The Delhi Police has arrested three men accused of running a digital arrest and investment fraud racket that allegedly cheated people of more than Rs 88 lakh, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Ex-Tirupati Board Chief Summoned Over Irregularities In Counting Of Offerings
content: The probe into alleged irregularities in the process of counting devotees' offerings intensified as the Andhra Pradesh Crime Investigation Department issued a formal notice to former TTD Board chairman Bhoomana Karunakar Reddy to appear before them.

title: PM Spoke Of 'Macaulay Mindset'. British Politician's India Impact Decoded
content: It will be 200 years in 10 years since the time British historian and politician Thomas Macaulay began a colonial campaign to uproot the cultural foundations of India, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said at an event on Monday.

title: Delhi Bomber Called Himself "Emir" Of White Collar Terror Module: Sources
content: Umar Un Nabi, the doctor-turned-suicide bomber who detonated a car bomb near Delhi's Red Fort, used to call himself "emir" to tell the other white collar terrorists of his module that he was their ruler.

title: How China's Social Media Curbs Worsened Arunachal Woman's Airport Ordeal
content: Prema Wangjom Thongdok -- an Arunachal-born, Indian-origin UK resident-- has claimed that she was detained and harassed by Chinese officials at Shanghai airport for nearly 18 hours after they refused to acknowledge her Indian passport as "valid".

title: Adani Gets Environmental Nod For Luxury Thiruvananthapuram Airport Hotel
content: The Union Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change cleared a Rs 136-crore luxury hotel proposal by Adani Airport Holdings Ltd within the Thiruvananthapuram International Airport premises.

title: 'No Cause For Concern': Civil Aviation Ministry On Ethiopian Volcanic Ash
content: The civil aviation ministry, along with the air traffic control India Meteorological Department (IMD), are closely monitoring the situation of ash plumes from the volcanic eruption in Ethiopia impacting flight operations.

title: PM Modi vs Mamata Banerjee: BJP's Kaleidoscopic Strategy In The Bengal Battlefield
content: As the sun sets on the electoral battle in Bihar, the BJP - which appears to have perfected the art of anticipation - has started laying the groundwork for its next big performance: the West Bengal assembly elections of 2026.

title: Student, 15, Jumps To Death After Being Scolded For Low Marks In Hyderabad
content: A Class 10 girl student jumped to her death from the fifth floor of a school building in Hyderabad on Tuesday.

title: "Not Inclined To Monitor Every Incident Of Hate Speech": Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court said on Tuesday that it is not inclined to either legislate or monitor every incident of hate speech across the country, as legislative measures, police stations, and high courts are already in place.

title: Bangladesh And Pak Move To Revive Military Ties With High-Level Visits
content: From high-profile military, diplomatic and political visits, Bangladesh and Pakistan are moving briskly when it comes to ties despite Pakistan's history of torture, rapes and atrocities on ordinary Bangladeshis during the liberation struggle of 1971.

title: "Wife's Pregnancy Can't Erase Acts Of Cruelty": Delhi Court Grants Divorce To Man
content: Pregnancy or temporary reconciliation cannot erase the previous acts of cruelty and abusive conduct of the wife towards her husband, the Delhi High Court has said while granting a divorce decree to a man.

title: Mountains Experience Warming 50% Faster Than Global Average: Study
content: Warming at high elevations in mountains, including the Himalayas, could be about 50 per cent faster than the global average since 1950, which can have potentially devastating consequences for over a billion people depending on the regions.

title: Indian Household Spending Shifting Towards Asset Building: Government Report
content: Household spending patterns in India are witnessing a major shift from basic necessities towards asset-building expenditure, highlighted a survey report by the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister.

title: Devendra Fadnavis' "Pataal Lok" Announcement In Mumbai Viral
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis injected virality using the name of a Prime Video thriller to an otherwise plain comment on infrastructure development plans for Mumbai.

title: Traditional Connections Not Meeting Your Needs? Try 'Relationship Anarchy'
content: With an emphasis on relationships that decentre prescribed notions of love and power, relationship anarchy is a compelling new approach to interpersonal and communal connection.

title: OpenAI Debuts ChatGPT Shopping Research Tool Ahead Of The Holidays
content: OpenAI unveiled a free artificial intelligence-powered shopping research tool that it says can generate a personalised buyer's guide for ChatGPT users during the holiday season.

title: Anti-Terror Agency To Probe 26/11 Mastermind Tahawwur Rana's Nationwide Recruitment Plan
content: Tahawwur Rana has confirmed his role in the attacks and told the agency that he had provided all support to David Headley during his visits to India to carry out the reconnaissance of the targets that were hit on that fateful night.

title: Free agent pickups: The players you need for a playoff push
content: the 12th Sunday of the season featured a historic outing by a Detroit Lions RB Jahmyr Gibbs and a notable comeback victories by the desperate Kansas City Chiefs and Dallas Cowboys . four teams served their bye this week, but none do this coming Thanksgiving week, which features a trio of games on Thursday .

title: Who's making the grade, and who's failing at the NHL quarter mark? Grades for all 32 teams
content: the 2025-26 season has reached its quarter mark, with all 32 teams having played more than 20 games . a first-quarter letter grade for all 32 clubs is through the games of Nov. 23 . they lead the NHL in goals per game while also giving up the fewest goals .

title: The main thing to know from every Week 12 game: Rams sit atop NFC after Eagles' meltdown
content: quarterback suffocated the 49ers' offense, forcing three turnovers to help backup quarterback Davis Mills seal the victory . quarterback shedeur Sanders beat the Raiders in the late window . it was the first time a Browns quarterback won their first start since 1995 .

title: Three comeback wins and what they mean: Barnwell on the Cowboys, Chiefs, Lions
content: Cowboys came back from a 10-point deficit in the fourth quarter to win in overtime . it was dangerous to have a big lead in the second half of the week 12 games . but other teams that took big leads had to fight to hold on for wins . the Falcons allowed the Saints to march up and down the field .

title: Let's overreact to Week 12: Is the J.J. McCarthy era already coming to an end?
content: the Minnesota Vikings are a good organization, and they made the decision to go all-in on quarterback J.J. McCarthy and ... well... it just has to get better one of these weeks, right? not this week . the Vikings have offensive line issues .

title: Projecting the College Football Playoff top 12 after Week 13
content: the Sooners beat the Tigers 17-6 in Norman . there wasn't any movement in this week's top 12 projection . a dominant win against a now sub.-500 team isn't going to change the way the committee views Ohio State as the most complete team in the country .

title: Offseason grades: Judging the Nimmo-for-Semien swap for Mets, Rangers
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Phoenix Mercury update logo and uniforms in image rebrand
content: the Phoenix Mercury rolled out a rebranded image with new uniforms and logos . the new logo and uniforms were revealed during a private event in Phoenix on friday . a goal was to modernize a logo that the organization believed was true to the 1990s, he says .

title: Transfer portal primer: 'At 12:01 a.m. on Jan. 2, you're going to see people instantly commit'
content: the transfer portal officially opens on Jan. 2, the day after the college football playoff quarterfinals . the spring portal window in April means programs have one shot to get this right if they want to win big in 2026 . this season has brought more proof of concept that a portal-heavy approach can dramatically flip a program's fortunes, with Indiana and Texas Tech in the national championship hunt .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who needs a win during Rivalry Week?
content: six teams are still eligible to reach the ACC conference championship game . another four are still in contention to win the Big 12 . the college football playoff selection committee's fourth of six rankings will be announced tonight . it's unclear if the committee will react to Lane Kiffin's uncertain future .

title: The wolves of Real Madrid are already snarling at Xabi Alonso's door
content: Xabi Alonso has defended his side following their 2-2 draw against Elche . the real madrid boss is in the top eight positions of the UEFA champions league . but he'll know he is. wolves are at the door and someone at his club is encouraging them to snarl .

title: 49ers top Panthers, as Christian McCaffrey beats former team
content: the 49ers beat the Carolina Panthers 20-9 in a game that figures to be pivotal in the NFC playoff chase . it happened again Monday night as the Niners overcame a litany of first-half mistakes to knock off a 49ers 20-9 . quarterback j'ayir brown provided the biggest slams for the Panthers .

title: 📈 CFB Power Rankings: Two new teams join
content: americanC averaged 190.8 rushing yards across its first 10 games this fall . the no. 7 Ducks improved to 10-1 after a 42-27 win over the Trojans . it's a second straight college football playoff appearance in the 2025 season .

title: Construction workers’ unions seek immediate revival of Welfare Board
content: Union representatives express concern that families of construction workers who died due to accidents or natural causes since 2018 have not yet received financial assistance from the board

title: Andhra Pradesh is the place to be, says Lokesh, hailing it as the South’s emerging investment powerhouse
content: The HRD Minister cites rising investor momentum driven by ₹13.25 lakh crore in MoUs, Google’s AI centre and major industrial commitments, even as experts say the State has cracked the South’s investor playbook

title: A.P. aims to improve cattle health, boost milk production
content: The State ranks seventh in the country with 13.946 million tonnes of annual milk production, supporting about 2.5 million dairy farmers

title: MCCI welcomes new labour codes
content: The labour codes are designed to simplify, streamline, and modernise the existing labour law framework and augurs well for both workers and employers

title: Envoys of five nations present credentials to President Murmu
content: The enovys who presented their credentials were Hadi Jaber, Ambassador of Lebanon; Sheilabai Bappoo, High Commissioner of Mauritius, and Abdoulaye Barro, Ambassador of Senegal, a statement from the President's office said

title: Pakistani couple elopes, crosses into Kutch on foot; detained by BSF
content: Popat and Gauri had fled their village in Pakistan, 8 km away from the international border, on Sunday (November 23, 2025) night, and covered the distance on foot, according to an official

title: Naidu gives nod to set up logistics infra corporation in A.P.
content: Conceived to transform the State into a premier logistics hub of the east coast, the corporation will act as the nodal agency to integrate ports, airports, road networks, inland waterways, and cold-storage chains to significantly reduce costs

title: Pawan Kalyan terms Ayodhya flag-hoisting a milestone in India’s cultural resurgence
content: Deputy Chief Minister says the ceremony reflects a revived national spirit and marks a key step in reclaiming India’s civilisational identity

title: Two more convicted in Vizag Navy espionage case
content: Ashok Kumar of Jhunjhunu district and Vikas Kumar of Alwar district in Rajasthan have bee awarded simple imprisonment of five years and 11 months

title: Closely monitoring volcanic ash plumes situation; no cause for concern: Civil Aviation Ministry
content: Earlier in the day, Air India announced the cancellation of 13 flights, including some international services, effective since November 21, due to the impact of the plumes of volcanic ash

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Watch: As Bangladesh seeks Sheikh Hasina’s extradition, what does the India-Bangladesh treaty say?
content: The interim government of Bangladesh has sent a letter to the Indian Ministry of External Affairs seeking Sheikh Hasina’s extradition. What are the terms of the extradition treaty between the two countries?

title: Study based on satellite assessment finds widespread PM2.5 pollution across India
content: Satellite data show 60% of India’s districts breach PM2.5 standards, with Delhi topping the list, and the Indo-Gangetic and Northeast airsheds emerging as year-round pollution hotspots, a report by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air says

title: Inaugural session of 18th Bihar Assembly from December 1
content: The members will be sworn in by Narendra Narayan Yadav, a senior JD(U) leader who was appointed the pro-tem Speaker by Governor Arif Mohammad Khan

title: Bengaluru ATM cash van heist: City Police arrest nine, recover ₹7.1 crore
content: While the police faced many challenges in the case, the toughest part was the arrest of the trio who had hired a cab to Hyderabad and used the mobile number of the cab driver to misguide the police, an official said.

title: West Bengal to teach its hospitals how to be more sensitive towards vulnerable communities
content: Workshops to build gender responsive healthcare and improve care for vulnerable communities, including LGBT persons

title: Winners and losers: Gibbs notches highest score of season, Taylor goes quiet
content: RB Jahmyr Gibbs rushed for 145 more yards than expected and had 15.5 rushing estimated points added . he now has three games with at least 36 fantasy points . his worst game of the season was against the new york Giants .

title: Karnataka farmers warn against resuming safari in Bandipur and Nagarahole, threaten agitation
content: Farmers say the authorities seem to be serving the cause of wealthy investors and politicians with stakes in the hospitality sector, rather than address the concern of the local villagers who face the brunt of conflict situation.

title: Israel approves proposal to bring all remaining 5,800 Jews from Northeast India
content: There have been intense debates around the Jewishness of Bnei Menashe in the past, but in 2005, the then Chief Rabbi of the Sephardi community, Rabbi Shlomo Amar, recognised them as "descendants of Israel", paving the way for their immigration to Israel

title: Man acquitted in 26/11 terror case can take up job not needing police clearance: Government to High Court
content: Additional public prosecutor Amit Palkar submitted a list of jobs that mandate a clearance character verification certificate from the police, which is required for all government, semi-government and municipal body jobs

title: One person killed Zubeen Garg, others cooperated: Assam CM
content: The Speaker allowed a discussion on the cultural icon’s death after the Opposition moved an adjournment motion

title: 'Environmental tragedy': Congress slams 'large-scale tree felling' for Adani's coal project in Madhya Pradesh
content: "This is an environmental tragedy and a social and economic disaster for the local Adivasi tribes who are reliant on the forests for their livelihood," Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh said.

title: Khandu condemns China after Arunachal woman detained at Shanghai Airport
content: Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu said, Arunachal Pradesh is and will always be an integral part of India

title: Movement Festival of Kerala debuts in Kochi with a showcase of contemporary dance performances from India and abroad
content: With the dance festival that kicks off on November 27, choreographer P Sreejith, dancers Paris Laxmi and Abhilash VS hope to change how contemporary dance is practised

title: Tax collection should be smooth process with minimum discomfort to taxpayer: President Murmu
content: President Murmu emphasises smooth tax collection, highlighting its importance for nation-building and urging transparency and technology in the process

title: India’s net FDI negative for second straight month in September as outflows exceed inflows
content: These figures refer to direct investment, which constitutes investment into assets, rather than portfolio investment, which has to do with shares in a company.

title: Mamata undertakes anti-SIR march from Chandpara to Matua-heartland Thakurnagar in Bengal
content: The procession, which was taken up by the Trinamool Congress supremo after addressing an anti-SIR rally at Bangaon town situated near the India-Bangladesh border, will culminate at Dhakuria school at Thakurnagar

title: Ahead of National Milk Day, Milma launches five new premium products
content: Kerala Minister for Animal Husbandry and Dairy Development J. Chinchurani will inaugurate the State-level National Milk Day celebrations on November 26 in Kollam. Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal will preside over the function

title: Harassment of Indian woman at Shanghai airport: ‘Whole process according to laws and regulations,’ says China denying allegation
content: Chinese officials assert that the treatment of Pema Wangjom Thongdok was compliant with legal protocols, while India demands accountability for what it deems a breach of sovereignty and citizen rights

title: Supreme Court tells petitioners alleging sexual abuse in ISKCON-run schools to approach child rights body
content: The plea alleged that internal records indicated serious cases of sexual abuse and that complaints made to the authorities had not been responded

title: Maharashtra Congress seeks 15-day extension from SEC to address draft voters' list issues
content: "Many voters are not in the draft list of wards they reside in and the situation is different in all municipal corporations of the State. This is a large number," says the letter

title: T.N. Chief Minister Stalin inaugurates Semmozhi Poonga in Coimbatore
content: The botanical park has been developed at an estimated cost of ₹208.5 crore. The proposal was first made by former Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi in 2010 and Mr. Stalin laid the foundation stone in December 2023.

title: Mysterious death of three relatives: bereaved family starts indefinite hunger strike in Jammu & Kashmir’s Kathua
content: Three members of the grieving families, led by Chamail Singh, who lost his son and brother in the incident, sat on an indefinite hunger strike inside the premises of Shiv Temple in Malhar area of Kathua district

title: Supreme Court dismisses Christian Army officer’s plea against termination of service; calls his actions ‘insult to troops’
content: The CJI said that Samuel Kamalesan's refusal to participate in regimental religious activities was “the grossest kind of indiscipline by an Army official”

title: 1983 Nellie massacre: Govt lays Mehta Commission report, distributes copies of Tewary Commission report in Assam Assembly
content: During the Assam Agitation, which took place from 1979 to 1985 against infiltration into the state, over 2,100 people were killed in a single night in the Nellie massacre of 1983

title: Constitution Day: President Droupadi Murmu to lead event at iconic Central Hall
content: As part of the event, the Constitution of India in nine languages — Malayalam, Marathi, Nepali, Punjabi, Bodo, Kashmiri, Telugu, Odia and Assamese — prepared by the Legislative Department of the Union law ministry, will be launched digitally

title: Kerala actor rape case: Court to pronounce verdict on December 8
content: The prosecution case is that the accused raped the woman actor in a moving car on February 17, 2017. The first accused, alleged the prosecution, recorded the alleged act in a mobile phone following the conspiracy

title: Congress high command has to put full stop on CM change confusion in Karnataka: Siddaramaiah
content: While Siddaramaiah is pushing for a reshuffle of his Cabinet, Shivakumar wants the party to first decide on leadership change, party sources said.

title: Aim for the moon, compete with me, astronaut Subhanshu Shukla tells students
content: Curious to see whether it will be a man or a woman from the country to step on the lunar surface, the Indian Air Force (IAF) Group Captain Subhanshu Shukla said the aspiring astronauts will have to compete with him

title: Newly formed Bihar Cabinet holds first meeting, decides to provide one crore jobs to youth in five years
content: “Bihar will be developed as a back-end hub and global workplace over the next five years," says Bihar Chief Secretary Pratyay Amrit

title: Working on third edition of Jan Vishwas law to decriminalise minor business offences: Piyush Goyal
content: “Ministry has already identified about 275-300 provisions, which can be decriminalised,” say Commerce and Industry Minister

title: 20 camera traps placed after woman’s death in suspected tiger attack in Nilgiris
content: The forest department has also lifted hair samples from the scene of the attack to verify the animal that attacked the victim

title: BJP accuses Kerala’s LDF govt of violating model code of conduct, sees political motive behind distribution of pension forms
content: BJP Kerala general secretary S. Suresh criticises circulation of Sthree Suraksha pension forms, alleging that it is part of a deliberate effort to sway voters

title: ECI calls four-member Trinamool Congress delegation for meeting, party insists on sending 10 leaders
content: Election Commission of India (ECI) pointed out that Trinamool leader Derek O'Brien had requested for an appointment for a delegation of party MPs

title: AIADMK brushes aside Panneerselvam’s deadline for reconciliation
content: Speculation is rife that expelled senior leader of the AIADMK, K.A. Sengottaiyan, is likely to soon join TVK led by actor Vijay. The Gobichettipalayam MLA was unavailable for comment.

title: Muskan, accused in sensitive ‘blue drum’ murder case, gives birth to baby girl
content: Muskan was brought to the Lala Lajpat Rai Memorial Medical College around 11.30 pm on Sunday (November 23, 2025) after her labor pain increased

title: Muzzling of pet dogs in public places not mandatory, Chennai Corporation tells Madras High Court
content: Justice V. Lakshminarayanan records the submission of GCC counsel that muzzling is only an advisory and that only leashing is mandatory

title: BLO removed from post for public display of nudity during SIR work in Kerala
content: The alleged incident happened while the BLO was filling up the enumeration forms while surrounded by people, including women, in Malappuram district

title: ED flags presence of jailed Sri Lankan woman’s name in Tamil Nadu voters’ list
content: The Sri Lankan national woman Letchumanan Mary Franciska overstayed in India citing COVID-19 and later obtained Aadhaar Card, PAN card, voters’ identity card, Indian passport, etc. on the basis of fake documents.

title: Is the Centre taking us ‘very lightly’, Supreme Court asks government in suo motu case hearing
content: A Bench of Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta chose to suo motu re-examine the level of compliance shown by States, Union Territories and the Centre to the 2020 judgment of the apex court

title: Payyanur bomb attack case in Kerala: CPI(M) local body poll candidate, aide sentenced to 20 years
content: Taliparamba Additional District Sessions Judge awards imprisonment of 20 years and fine of ₹2.5 lakh each to convicts V.K. Nishad and T.C.V. Nandakumar. They will effectively serve 10 years in jail each

title: SIR-induced 'reverse migration' to Bangladesh: Bengal Governor takes train to reach Murshidabad
content: C.V. Ananda Bose had on Monday (November 24, 2025) visited the Hakimpur border outpost in North 24 Parganas district and interacted with local people to take a first-hand stock of the ground situation

title: Gram panchayat employees stage protest in Kalaburagi over unpaid salary
content: They urged district authorities to resolve long-pending service issues affecting bill collectors, others

title: Ambedkar, Constitution subjected to 'ferocious assault' by RSS: Congress
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications Jairam Ramesh recalled that in his closing speech before moving the resolution, Ambedkar had hailed the role of the Congress in drafting the Constitution

title: RSS must realise that permissions come from constitutional provisions, not from shouting Jai Shri Ram, says Dalit Sangharsha Samiti
content: For the first time in its 100-year history, the RSS had to follow the Constitution and the law when its route march was allowed in Chittapur on November 16, 2025, as per court directions

title: Lack of transparency, law and order issues will cost DMK in 2026: G.K. Vasan
content: People of Tamil Nadu feel that treating the Union government as an enemy does not help the State in any way, the  Tamil Maanila Congress (Moopanar) leader said.

title: PM Modi holds roadshow to Ram temple ahead of flag ceremony
content: Many held the tricolour while some had the BJP’s flag bearing the lotus symbol as the Prime Minister’s convoy moved past them amid heavy security deployment

title: Ambulance driver 'abandons' mother, newborn in Palghar; probe ordered
content: “On November 24, while being transported home after discharge, the ambulance driver allegedly halted the vehicle 2km before her village in Mokhada taluka, and left her behind,” say officials

title: Volcanic ash from Ethiopia forces flight cancellations in Hyderabad, RGIA urges travellers to check latest flight status
content: The Hyderabad airport stated that some flights may experience delays or cancellations depending on evolving conditions

title: Madhampatty Pakashala case: Madras HC refuses to restrain Joy Crizildaa from using the brand’s hashtag on social media
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar dismissed the interim injunction application filed by Madhampatty Thangavelu Hospitality Private Limited

title: Zubeen’s death ‘plain and simple murder’: Himanta tells Assam Assembly
content: The Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said the government is also equally seized of the matter and requested the Speaker to allow the adjournment motion

title: Shalibanda electronics showroom fire: One killed, eight injured; officials examine explosion and car crash angles
content: A case has been registered by the Moghalpura police, and further investigation is underway to determine the exact trigger for the incident as well the identity of the deceased

title: Volcanic ash plumes: Air India cancels flights; conducts inspection of aircraft
content: Ash clouds from the recent eruption of the Hayli Gubbi volcano in Ethiopia are impacting flight operations, and there are reports suggesting that clouds are drifting towards the western parts of India

title: Ash cloud from Ethiopia volcano to clear India by 7.30 p.m.: IMD
content: Forecast models indicated ash influence over Gujarat, Delhi-NCR, Rajasthan, Punjab and Haryana on November 25, 2025, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said

title: Kerala local body polls: Kudumbashree ‘candidates’ bank on people connect to sail through
content: The intersection of involvement in the Kudumbashree network and political ambitions has become the go-to for political parties of all hues in order to pick candidates for the local body elections

title: Kerala local body polls: LDF vying for a hat-trick in traditional UDF stronghold Sulthan Bathery
content: Ruling council believes that the developmental activities undertaken over the past 10 years will trump the tradition. Feud within Congress in  Wayanad district has put  UDF in a disadvantage.  NDA is hoping for a repeat and possibly surpass its performance in the parliamentary polls of 2024, when  BJP had enough votes within the municipality to come second

title: ACB clocked 621 cases in five years but 519 await prosecution nod: Forum for Good Governance
content: Forum says prolonged pendency is weakening deterrence, emboldening corrupt officials and creating the impression that the system protects wrongdoers
